attributes.action: Decriminalise Abortion & remove it from the Offences against the Person Act 1861
attributes.additional_details: Women have a right to determine the destiny of their own body.
attributes.background: The 1967 Abortion Act does not change the fact that Abortion is still a criminal Act in the U.K. to this day, excepting Northern Ireland. This must be remedied immediately by removing the process of abortion as a crime in the original  Offences against the Person 1861 Act.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Decriminalise abortion: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619159

Include abortion rights in the Bill of Rights: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619334
